conclusion: Need to compare distances traveled by Cars A and B from t=0 to t=10 seconds.
Car A's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 40 m/s from t=0 to t=10 seconds; remains constant at 40 m/s from t=10 to t=30 seconds.
Car B's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 40 m/s from t=0 to t=20 seconds; continues to increase linearly from t=20 to t=30 seconds.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A from t=0 to t=10 seconds using area under velocity-time graph.
Distance traveled by Car A is 200 meters.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B from t=0 to t=10 seconds using area under velocity-time graph.
Distance traveled by Car B is 100 meters.
Compare distances: Car A (200 meters) vs Car B (100 meters).
Car A is ahead of Car B at t=10 seconds.
